meanings.definition: The act of removing lint or other small fibers from clothing or fabric.
meanings.sent1: After doing the laundry, she spent time linting her favorite sweater.
meanings.sent2: Linting is important to keep clothes looking clean and neat.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his cat was a linting expert, always leaving fur on his clothes.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous linting turned her old coat into a brand new-looking garment.
meanings.sent5: The linting process involves carefully picking out tiny fibers from the fabric.

meanings.definition: The process of analyzing code for potential errors or issues.
meanings.sent1: Software developers use linting to catch mistakes in their code early on.
meanings.sent2: Linting helps ensure that the program runs smoothly without any bugs.
meanings.sent3: The computer science professor made a game out of linting code for his students.
meanings.sent4: In the world of programming, linting is like having a second pair of eyes on your work.
meanings.sent5: The importance of linting cannot be overstated when it comes to writing reliable software.
